Exercises Reflection

Exercise 5 involved creating a Personal Schedule Page using HTML table components such as table, tr, th, and td, along with comments to explain color-coded categories. Through this process, I learned how essential tables are in presenting structured data clearly and systematically. Designing the schedule required not only technical accuracy but also thoughtful organization, as each row and column needed to reflect a logical and readable arrangement. One of the most valuable aspects of the activity was learning how color could be used intentionally to enhance readability and visual hierarchy. Assigning specific colors to particular activities helped create a layout that was easy to follow and interpret at a glance. This experience deepened my understanding of how visual design principles complement HTML structure to produce more user-friendly digital interfaces. Beyond technical learning, the exercise prompted personal reflection. Seeing my weekly activities laid out in an organized format allowed me to evaluate how I spend my time and identify areas for improvement. It made me realize that web design is not only about displaying information but also about creating tools that can support productivity and self-awareness. Overall, this exercise significantly strengthened my HTML skills, especially in formatting structured data and designing functional layouts. It demonstrated how simple tags, when used effectively, can transform information into a coherent and visually appealing digital resource.

Author: Isabella Faith A. Delamida
